intro: Gonolobus cearensis, commonly known as the Brazilian velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and yellow flowers. The plant is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and agricultural fields. It has a climbing habit and produces pods that contain seeds dispersed by wind. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological and agricultural studies.
